result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J Traver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's probation revoked - sentenced to county jail/hoc on 11-24-15; unpaid court obligations of $443 and supervision fees of $840

Defendant Thomas J Traver in court, in custody with attorney Michael Hughes.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sentencing recommendation put on the record. Court sentenced defendant to 4 months jail, consecutive to present sentence in Dane Cty. case 14CM1959. Huber granted under jail rules. Court granted 81 days jail credit. Civil judgment granted for unpaid financials.
Appointed Attorney Michael Hughes
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 11-24-2015 03:30 pm

Cases heard: 14CF156 & 13CF76, Defendant Thomas J Traver in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In 13CF76, count 2 amended to misdemeanor battery with domestic abuse enhancer. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant plead no contest to count 2 in 13CF76. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, 1 yr. probation, $543 costs, Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations, complete domestic abuse counseling program.  Cts. 1&3 read in and dismissed.  Defendant plead no contest to ct. 1 in 14CF156, 2 yr. probation, same conds. as in 13CF76, $543 costs. Ct. 2 read in and dismissed. Jail credit in 13CF76, 3 days, 14CF156, 2 days granted. Posted cash bond applied.

Cases heard: 13CF76 & 14CF156, Defendant Thomas J Traver in court with attorney Ryan T Frank.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court ordered cases to be reset due to substitution being previously filed in 13CF76.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
Atty Ryan Frank
